comment: Really great math 1111 choice. Lectures are fairly straight forward, there were only a few concepts that I did not understand. Do all the HW and show up to class and you'll get an A easily. Also, he tries to be funny, and it fails most of the time, but at least he tries.

Professor Birrell was a caring guy. Although his teaching style was boring, he made jokes to keep everyone awake. He uses Aleks, well tries to because he was not very good at it, but does care about his students. He was a good algebra professor.

Rob is very confusing to say the least. There was a new program that we were required to use called ALEKS but Rob had no idea how to work it, so I'm saying that because whatever he taught in the lecture wouldn't be on the ALEKS so you basically self-teach which can be difficult if math isn't your best subject. He also posts his notes online

All of his in class discussions never helped w/ the material. U basically have 2 teach UR self. the 1st couple of test where on aleks & the last 2 including the final were on paper which made its more difficult to take since we got use to the online style. If he does use aleks again make sure 2 actually work hard on the 1st knowledge check.

Professor Birrell is at best ok. His lectures are awfully boring. I stopped going one day out of the week about halfway through the semester. Uses the program ALEKS and its awful. If he gives you the option to take the tests on paper, take them on paper!! The online tests are so sensitive and will mark you off for simple mistakes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Birrell is very kind and always tries to make himself available for questions. However, he often gets led off topic and will make the same one joke over and over again throughout the class and the semester. Without ALEKS I would have not done well. He can be confusing and will make mistakes and won't realize it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was very good for me since I struggle with math but he helps and you can pass his class if you do the work. Theres four tests and he uses aleks but he gives you the option of taking it in on paper which I would recommend since aleks grades harsh over little details. Overall good math class

I'm not a huge math person, but he makes class fun. He does use an online program for hw and tests (ALEKS). Homework on ALEKS takes forever, and there is a lot of homework, but the homework will help your grade dramatically. Professor Birrell is hilarious during class and keeps it interesting. If you're fairly good at math, you should be fine.

Professor Birrell himself is a nice guy. He uses ALEKS to do the homework and tests but it's terrible because he has no control over the material there except for the test. I basically have to teach myself new concepts when they pop up because anything we learn in class is useless. It would have been better taken as an online class at this point.

he makes a lot of mistakes during lecture, but he fixes them quickly. tests and HW are all online on aleks, which to say the least, sucks. he is very nice guy though and will answer and questions you have. however, the bad format of aleks and the tests makes the class very hard to get an A in. the program is ver y sensitive to small marginal error
tests are hard so make sure you study very hard. made a 55 on a test i studied hours for and went to tutoring so watch out

Professor Birrell is funny and keeps you engaged in class while still teaching the material and making sure everyone understands it. He genuinely cares about his students and will help you, it is really difficult to fail as long as you make an effort. If math isn't your strong point don't miss too many classes though. Grade is from tests and hw.

Mr. Birrell is an older man that's getting ready to retire soon. He can be a little scatter-brained and makes errors here and there, but he's always quick to catch his mistakes and own up to them. He covers a lot of material and is always great at answering questions. Makes a lot of dad jokes, nice man, solid instructor. Physical book not required.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Patient, instructional, willingly gives ample class time opportunities to clarify any lack of understanding and comprehension, but you must speak up asking the questions.  He's a Professor, not a class warden on attendance but he does take roll and if you show up and pay attention, do the practice homework you'll learn the material and pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Birrell is an amazing teacher! Math has always been a little hard for me, but he makes it easy to understand. There are weekly homework assignments, but nothing hard and you can use examples on mymathlab. He gives practice tests that are almost identical to the actual tests. Attendance is important. Beware of his corny math jokes! Great professor.
hes nice, mymathlab based and drops lowest test.

Birrell puts forth an effort to take as much pain out of math as possible. Excellent professor that actually cares about his students. He even will invite students to office hours on weekends to try and help them. Course is software based utilizing MyMathLab - which isn't the greatest - and the textbook is vague - so lean heavy on attending class.

I really enjoyed Professor Birrell. His expectation is for you to care enough to come to class, participate, do the homework and be willing to apply yourself. His is pretty funny and does a good job at making math interesting. You will only get out of the class what YOU put into it. I would definitely take him again!

Not a fan of Mr. Birrell, he is extremely nice but his way of teaching is confusing and unclear. He teaches as if you already comprehend the material to the same degree that he does. Would not take again.

Absolutely love Prof. Birrell! He is so nice and ALWAYS willing to help you out if you ask for it. Doesn't move on unless you understand it. Homework isn't bad, gives study guides for test, does reviews before tests. I got all As on my tests. Would definitely recommend him to anyone.
He's a nice guy, but the way he presents material is sometimes not clear. His homework platform, launchpad, gave us problems all semester. Tests are hard, but if you study, you'll be fine.

Awesome professor. Cracks jokes all the time. Lectures and homework are pretty easy. A point of warning: TESTS ARE IMPOSSIBLE. I always showed up, did the homework, attended tutoring, but the tests destroyed my grade.  He even told a story where a chemistry major proctoring his test couldn't even pass his test in a previous year.
He's cool

He does not explain material well and is scatter brained so it often seems like he does not understand the material. He has tests that are needlessly complex just to show you know the material. If I could change it, I would not have taken this teacher. I am not saying this because I got a got grade either, I got an a, but he is not a good teacher.

He is a nice guy, but he is not a good teacher. He will only do one or two problems for each topic and not really explain them. At least once a class he will make a mistake on the board and then spend twenty minutes trying to figure out the algebra. He taught us the wrong formula one day then told us he did not have time to teach us the right way.

He goes over what's on a test before hand.  If you read the book the homework is easy.  Super helpful.  Offers extra credit as needed.  Goes the extra mile for students who ask.  But allows you to fail if you are just plain lazy.  Class attendance not mandatory but really helpful.

Do not take this class or be fooled by the high ratings. If you look close, most of the good ratings are from people taking remedial math. I just finished calculus I with an A and nearly failed Birrell's precalculus. He is the most confusing instructor; does problems wrong and then expects you to follow despite multiple redoes. Nice guy but no.

Good professor. It's not an easy A, but if you pay attention in class, do all the homework, and study for the test you will do fine in his class. He puts out test reviews for each test and the questions are almost identical to the test questions. If you do good on the test review you will do fine on the test.

He is very disorganized, if he made a mistake on the board it would take him a long time to realize it. I would not recommend him because he is pretty bad at explaining matters. The tests were difficult but he gives partial credit where it is deserved.

Im terrible at math always have been. He doesnt seem to have all of his marbles. Writing wrong numbers on the board. He just seems off.. i prayed for a c and just passed because the matrix was a easy A for me. Im not taking him for 098.

I'm in this class now and he really helps you understand everything! I suck at math and it takes me longer than others to grasp everything but he answers all your questions and will work with you because he TRULY cares about his students. Just pay attention, ask questions, take notes, and do the homework you'll be fine. I'm taking him for 098 next.

I am not enjoying this class. Partly because he does not follow his own syllabi and goes so far ahead into the syllabi that it makes keeping up very difficult. Basically, he tends to cover units too fast. I'll pass, but I will NOT take him for 0098.

Loved this teacher and his class! Birrell is super helpful and awesome at what he does. His class isn't boring and he works through every type of problem that you might see on a test. Homework is due once a week online. Go to the reviews and take practice quizzes online and you'll make an A. Don't buy the book though!!! Just get the online access!

Great professor, easy on tests and gives points for showing your work on scratch paper. Reviews everything, but you have to pay attention. He doesn't "lecture" with writing stuff out, mainly uses lots of examples. If you are good at math then it will be an easy A.

Absolutely LOVED professor Birrell. I am awful at math & managed to get an A in 0097 & now have maintained an A this semester in 0098. I wish I could take him for 1111. He is extremely lenient & helpful. Do the homework & come to class with questions. He cracks corny jokes every once in a while. He has really helped me improve my math skills. TAKE!

He is a nice and funny guy but he just is not clear while teaching. He's extremely unorganized. He would do a problem on the board, mess up three times, then expect us to follow him perfectly. All tests and homework is online. I took AP Calculus in high school and I thought that pre-cal would be easy, boy was I wrong.

Awesome! Amazing!  Always been horrible N math & He made it 2 where I could actually feel "not lost". & if u were ever "lost", he would schedule a 1 on 1 with u & sit w/ U until U understand it. He tells U what will B on tests, goes over the probs on the test 4 overall class retention, he wants U 2 pass! Show up, do the homework & U will pass.
He was a great Professor! He is very funny and kind; he omitted the lowest test grade and that saved my A! You should definitely take his class.

Absolutely wonderful teacher. He's nice, funny (a little corny at times), and actually cares about his students. He'll help you pass the class. He grades very leniently and will give you half-credit where possible. You don't always have to show up, but if you do, he basically tells you what will be on the test. TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

I looked at the reviews before attending his class, and I must say - they are so correct. Mr. Birrell truly cares about you passing the class and will take the time to explain something in as many different ways as he needs to. So excited to take him again next semester for 0098.

I am currently taking precalc as a dual enrollment student with Birrell, and so far I have loved his class. He is a very engaging teacher, and I felt well prepared for the tests. He posts a 50 question pre-test on mymathlab, and the format of the questions from the pre-test are extremely similar to the actual test. He wants his students to succeed

I really couldn't stand math before I took his class, but now can say that I actually enjoy it. If you have a problem with anything he'll help you directly until you understand it, his presentations are clear, concise and succinct. He is more than fair with homework grades and even points missed on a test due to syntax error. STRONGLY RECOMMEND!!!

Very laid back teacher. Sarcastic but fun.  attendance is not neccesarily mandatory but he will give test hints to those who show up. very clear and concise presentations.  Overall one of my favorite classes i have taken
great professor!!!!

I suck at Math but he made it so easy.  Best math teacher I've ever had!  He's always happy to answer as many questions as you want.  Helps you go through practice tests and the practice tests are always harder than the actual test.  Plan to take him for all my math classes.

Professor Birrell was awesome, he was very patient, and understanding, worked at a pretty good pace that was sufficient for the entire class. He covers his test and the compass material if taking 099. You will do great just as long as you take notes and complete your homework assignments.. two thumbs up!
He is such an awesome professor. I am so happy that I took his class. I look forward to taking him in the fall for the next level.
Made it a lot easier!

I love him so much! I have never EVER had such a great math teacher!! He is really laid back and loves interacting with you! He makes jokes all the time and always had the class laughing! I REALLY REALLY REALLY wish that he could my math teacher for this semester :( I am going to miss him! He always helps no matter what! PLEASE PLEASE take him!

this is the best math teacher ive ever had. he is super layed back, easy going, loves to interact with students, and is an overall nice guy. he actually cares for his students, and tried to make them pass, even if u mess up some. it is such an easy class. BEST MATH TEACHER IVE EVER HAD. show up to class, hes awesome

mr birrel was perfect for this course.  he explains things at a slower pace and takes time to answer all questions.  show up to class, do your homework, and participate in test reviews and you will pass.  great teacher!

I have been out of school for 22 years.  Math has always been my worst subject.  This teacher has made coming back to Math enjoyable which I never though could be possible.  He is a wonderful teacher and I highly recommend him.
Wonderful teacher !!!!!!!!!!!!!
Amazing Teacher!!!
Great professor. Learned alot from him. Goes over tests sometimes. Gives second chances. Take him if you can

Birrell is an AMAZING teacher! I have never been good in math, but I received a high A in his class. He takes his time to make sure you understand what is going on and he gives practice tests before every exam. The practice tests are EXACTLY like the real test, do those and you'll get an A.TAKE THIS TEACHER!!!

Great Professor!!! He is sarcastic and makes corny jokes, but he is very fun. Even if the entire class fails a test he gives you a second chance to improve. He makes himself available and works with his students so they can better understand the material. I wish he could teach other math courses.

Love him, love him, love him. I cannot say enough good things about him. He made class fun and explains things really well. He knows what he is talking about and you can tell he likes teaching. I only wish he taught other courses so I could take him again.
very helpful!  great guy.  take him if you can!
Excellent Professor!  Helps with whatever you need, will meet with you outside of the class if you need extra help.  I would recommend to anyone that has a hard time with math!

If you've ever had trouble with math you NEED to take this prof!!! He sincerely wants you to succeed and is a very nice person. The class is fast paced but he can find 50 ways of explaining the same thing so you really get it. I never understood math yet I got an A in this class and actually get it.
Great Prof.!!!! Is intrested in student's sucess. Easy to understand. Corny jokes, but they break up the monotony. 99 moves quickly! Use practice tests! Highly Recommend!!!!
He makes it fun!

Prof Rob really is the greatest professor ever! Everyone in class passed the exit Compass the first time. Also, his record with previous students and taking the Compass is excellent. I believe he has had two failures in his ten years. Class moves fast, but it is supposed too

He was by far my favorite professor this semester!! He is very helpful and he always tells these jokes that barely anyone gets, but its still hilarious. He teaches great and usually explains it once and evryone understands!!
Great teacher! Do the homework, but most importantly do the practice tests over and over again. The tests are based on the practice test. Pretty funny jokes to break up the monotony.
Professor Rob is great. Highly recommend taking his class, he really cares if you are understanding, and he's very helpfull! Love Mr. Rob
GREAT TEACHER! Got A's on all of the tests. He is very down-to-earth and willing to help! Highly recommended!
Helpful, Teaches Well, All Work Done Online, Highly Recommend
Grate Professor!!!!!!!!
EASY class and attendance NOT mandatory! I did everything online and only went to class on test days! 2nd time taking him and got an A both times!

I had settled for just not being a "math person" & thinking it'd just never get it. --Mr. Birrell changed all that! For the first time ever,  I enjoyed math. This was due to this incredible professor. I loved going to his math class more than any other class. He really cares that you understand, keeps things upbeat & is always available.  Love him!
Great Teacher!!!!

Prof. Birrell is one of the shining stars in the University Dept. He is a instructor who has a passion for what he does. He wants everyone to understand math and makes every attempt to assist the students. He definitely helps offset the marginal teachers in the department. Wish I could take him for more advanced math classes!

THE BEST!  Will go over something time and time again for you until you get it.  He even helped me when I was out of his class and in Math 1101...he took his own time in the evening at his office to help.  Class is fun and he actually helped me to like algebra.  For the most part :)

Great teacher!  Extends Homework. Goes over practice test in class before the actual test.He uses My Mathlab so everything is onthe computer.You can redo homework questions untill you get 100.Class is easy and professor is FUN! I would recommed you show up to class although he doesn't care.  math 099 is very fast notes on Monday and test Wednesday
Really enjoyed his class. Easy. Listen and you'll do fine.
Ok, if Prof. Birrell taught every math class at KSU-I would seriously think about being a math major. However, he doesn't. But he gave me a love of math I will never forget and I adore him for it!

Prof. Birrell will change your mind about math-guaranteed. I was so afraid of math and he made me come to love it and I went on to make an A in calculus! He continued to help me after I left his classes. I attribute my further A grades all to him. He is the best and if you want a good, solid math foundation-take him.
He's pretty cool. Doesn't give busy work. He's pretty clear and he's a fair grader.

AWESOME teacher.  He explains everything so clearly and until you understand it.  I wish he taught more upper level classes.  He even will help you after you leave the class...wonderful teacher!!  You'll love him!

I like this professor a lot.  I think he is a good math/algebra teacher but I never learned any of these concepts in high school almost 3 decades ago and need a professor that will go much slower.  That said he is a good teacher and he is very personable/fun.
Awesome teacher, very clear and will explain whatever is not clear until you understand it.  Homework isn't mandatory but helpful if you want to know what you're doing.

Prof. Birrell is the best math prof KSU has! He will make sure you have the basics and it will help you when you get to other math classes. He is funny and always willing to help. You will never regret taking his class!
He was very fun and taught math to where i finally understand it.  I would definitely recommend him if you are not the best at math.  i'm taking him for 098 too.
Professor Birrell is very witty and make the class fun.  Even if you loathe math, you'll enjoy coming to his class!
I really like his class and recommend this professor.

Mr. Birrell is a good teacher and a sweet guy but my total lack of knowledge of Algebra made it very difficult. If you love Algebra and have the fundamentals down, Mr. Birrell's class will be perfect for you. I would suggest for those who may have always had a tough time in Algebra to take either Mrs. Jones or Mrs. Naidu.

Prof. Birrell is an awesome math teacher! I had such math phobia that it kept me from going back to school for years. Thanks to this professor, I think I may even LIKE math-haha! He gives you only as much as you can handle, is always congenial and fair, and willing to go to great lengths to explain things. I will take him for Math 098!

Awesome! Math never clicked for me until this class.  Mr Birrell explains everything and you don't feel stupid when you have a question. His jokes are awful but you can't help but laugh. He makes math so much less intimidating and he always reviews the day before a test. He tends to digress when he's talking but he's easy to get back on track.
He is so good! Really knows math and is helpful too! His tests are easy and he will go over the material. Highly recommended professor, good luck finding a spot!

His test were really easy until the final when he let you bring in one page of notes and then gave a HARD exam. He curved it though. Do the hw and you will be fine. I didn't go to class and still got an A. He was a lil corny with jokes and he likes alcohol which was talked about in class. If you have fun in class he will too. Study for the FINAL!
Helpfull, kind, and willing to go the extra mile to help you.
The best math teahcer I have ever had. He takes all the fear out of math. He is very helpful and really cares about students who work hard. Excellent, excellent teacher!
Pretty good teacher. Makes corny jokes.

very funny guy,most of work was done on eduspace for hw cept for the easy 20 question tests done on the comp in the lab,u basically dont have to go to class just as long as u go the day before the test bc he does awesome reviews
He explained very well and so far his grading was very lienent. you can defiantly make an A or B in the class

I was really nervous starting class because it was my first college class and I missed the first 2 weeks. Prof. Birrell let me make up all my work and I still ended up getting a B!! He's awesome, just don't write down all his stories.....

Really enjoyed this class.  I was so out of practice, but Prof Birrell really made it easy.  He has a ton of experience teaching this stuff, so his delivery is very effective.  I will take his class again for 0098.
Very nice guy, enjoys his job.  However he does not teach in out of the book. He jumps around subject to subject, I found him hard to follow at times.

I had this guy in my freshmen year. he is awesome n kewl. He luvs to tell jokes and hear jokes. He is willing to work out with you about grades. He even drops one low test grade. Less homework but u better do homework in able to pass his class. I give him 5*.

I had him for both and highly recommend him!  The 0098 class was during the summer semester which was hard but he will take the extra step to help.  It is too bad that he does not teach regular credit classes.
I love this guy.. he's upbeat and enjoys what he does. I wish he taught higher level classes.
He is very funny and interesting.  He makes the math seem so much more simple and fun.  Great teacher!!
No Comments
He is very helpful. Cracks funny jokes in class. Very upbeat. Willing to help after class. Goes over the whole homework assignment iin class.

he's very helpful and keeps the class light but telling really corny jokes. always there when you need help. he makes sure you understand the material before you move on. he breaks down math to make it easier.
